line_1: What need You have two Hides of Leather?
line_2: And if two Boots keep out the Weather;

line_1: Whare ye may nobly rax your leather,
line_2: We've worn to crazy years thegither;

line_1: Whare ye may nobly rax your leather,
line_2: We'll toyte about wi' ane anither;

line_1: Whare ye may nobly rax your leather,
line_2: Wi' tentie care I'll slit thy tether,

line_1: And what is Parchment else but Leather?
line_2: Can like the Stars foretel the Weather;

line_1: The Bat, because her Wings are Leather,
line_2: And as the Boding Owl, or rather

line_1: Of names on scraps of leather,
Tho' whyles ye moistify your leather,
Tho' whyles ye moistify your leather,
line_2: Till whare ye sit, on craps o' heather,

line_1: Tho' whyles ye moistify your leather,
